block.p: MarchFirst in Chicago and Dentsu Inc. in Tokyo are forming a joint venture named DentsuMarchFirst, a professional services company that will open on Jan. 1 in Tokyo with 40 employees. MarchFirst and Dentsu are each investing an estimated $15 million in the joint venture, which will be owned 50-50.

Red Sky in New York, an agency partly owned by the Omnicom Group that specializes in interactive communications, sold a minority stake to Texaco in White Plains. Terms were not disclosed. In August, Texaco named Red Sky to handle interactive consulting; a wholly owned Omnicom agency, BBDO New York, part of BBDO Worldwide, creates corporate campaigns for Texaco.

And Edelman Interactive Solutions in New York, a unit of Edelman Public Relations Worldwide, and Ebeon in Dublin, which offers e-business services, are investing an estimated $7.3 million in a joint venture that will have 200 employees working from offices in cities throughout Europe and the United States. The joint venture will offer Internet services like strategy, design, marketing and technology.
